section.description: User performs query on the database. User is then given the option to save the query for use at a later date.

stakeholders.actor: Wants to be able to search for an Issue with great detail (including all Attribute fields) and then be able to save it for reuse at a later date.

results.result: After the search, a list of matching Issues are displayed or go directly to the Issue if only one matches. A button and small text box is presented on the results page that gives the user the chance to save the query with a value that is typed in. If no value is typed in, then a default value "Saved Query X" is assigned (where X is a number). After the query has been saved, the query results page is displayed again.

There should also be a text entry box on the Issue Search page where the User can type in the name for a saved query. This will save the query when the search is done. The result is to show the search results page.

notes.note: Need to consider the ability to modify saved searches. This functionality should go into a search editor usecase.
